image.altText: A woman with long red-brown hair stands looking down seriously at sheets of paper on a kitchen island.

props.synopsis: Criticism of the ACT Revenue Office stamp duty concession scheme intensifies, including calls for reform within the legislative assembly, after Canberrans received notices they owed tens of thousands of dollars within a few weeks.

title.children: Steph separated from her ex years ago. Then she got a $35,000 bill

image.altText: A man with short white hair in a burgundy sweater with his arms crossed looks concerned.

props.synopsis: A tight race was the last thing ACT voters expected before this election, and not until the final days of the campaign for Bean did Labor seriously worry independent Jessie Price could snatch the seat — next time, the party will leave nothing to chance.

title.children: Contest for Bean brings David Smith face to face with political mortality

image.altText: A 56-year-old man smiling and wearing glasses.

props.synopsis: The family of Canberra man Harri Jokinen, who was killed during a high-speed police pursuit on the Monaro Highway in 2021, hopes an inquest into his death will lead to a change in policy.

title.children: Family hopes coronial inquest leads to change in police pursuit policy

image.altText: emergency services at a property on Fernleigh Close Windellama after a boy was accidentally shot

props.synopsis: A 14-year-old boy charged in relation to the death of a nine-year-old at Windellama has faced court for the first time.

title.children: Teen pleads not guilty over accidental shooting death of 9yo near Goulburn

image.altText: Surf emu

props.synopsis: When a businessman imported emus to his private island on the NSW south coast, he did not realise they could swim for freedom and set up their own thriving colony.

title.children: Emus swam 'like periscopes' to freedom and set up life on the beach

image.altText: A woman with dark blonde hair pulled back smiles lightly.

props.synopsis: The ACT health minister apologises for mistakes that led to the death of Jessica Bovill, who was given a dose of sodium bicarbonate "far in excess" of what was recommended, resulting in her death at the Canberra Hospital.

title.children: Jessica died due to a hospital error. Her family was told it was suicide

image.altText: a horse runing

props.synopsis: An appeal has been made to NSW parliament to scrap a bill recognising the heritage value of wild horses in the Kosciuszko National Park.

title.children: Politicians back appeal to scrap bill recognising heritage value of brumbies

image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: A 25-year-old Canberra man pleads not guilty in the ACT Magistrates Court to allegedly performing a Nazi salute in front of the Gold Coast Hebrew Congregation in October last year.

title.children: Canberra man charged with performing Nazi salute outside synagogue

image.altText: A pharmacist in a chemist.

props.synopsis: Every morning when Chris Lawler opens the doors of his Canberran pharmacy, he knows some of the customers won’t be coming to purchase, but to steal. A new online portal offers hope things might get better.

title.children: Shoplifters raid this pharmacy ‘daily’, but police are too busy to act

image.altText: JJ holding the Eurovision trophy while singing as confetti flutters down

props.synopsis: Austria has won the 2025 Eurovision Song Contest and will take home the translucent microphone-shaped trophy.

title.children: 'Dreams come true': Austria takes Eurovision crown with Israel in second

image.altText: A middleaged man in a blue shirt, which has the logo blurred, stands outside a family home on a grass strip.

props.synopsis: Multiple witnesses giving evidence at the coronial inquest into the April 2024 stabbing rampage have stressed the "benefit of hindsight" in revisiting their interactions with Joel Cauchi.

title.children: 'Did the best I could': Witnesses defend actions amid Bondi stabbing inquest

image.altText: Teacher points at ipad with three highschool students in class, smiling and looking at content online.

props.synopsis: The governor-general says misinformation is the scourge of our times — and Australia's future is at stake.

title.children: Schools to adopt media literacy course in wake of crushing civics results

image.altText: A drawing of Sean Combs, wearing a pale blue jumper, making a heart sign with his hands while standing in court.

props.synopsis: Disgraced hip-hop mogul Sean "Diddy" Combs always knew how to attract attention but he probably never anticipated the circus that now surrounds him at his criminal trial.

title.children: Giggles, scuffles and trial by TikTok: The Diddy courtroom circus

image.altText: A boy in a red shirt sits in front of a building razed to the ground

props.synopsis: Israeli forces ramp up a bombing campaign that has killed hundreds of people over 72 hours, amid ceasefire talks with Hamas.

title.children: Israel launches expanded offensive in Gaza amid ceasefire talks

image.altText: Conclave elects the new pope, at the Vatican

props.synopsis: The contrast of Pope Leo and Donald Trump goes far beyond Christendom or American economic power; it goes to what we want from our leaders, who we will follow, who we will heed, and where our future lies.

title.children: The pickle of 'woke' Pope Leo for MAGA Catholics

image.altText: A man in white and a man in blue in front of a production line.

props.synopsis: Manufacturers in China race to fulfil US orders as the reciprocal tariff pause takes effect, but the renewed trade war has already caused some businesses to take drastic measures.

title.children: What Chinese factories and businesses think about the US tariff pause

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed and a serious look on his face. The Hard Quiz has been added behind his head

props.synopsis: Each week, I optimistically roll out another Hard Quiz for your Sunday morning entertainment. Surely you can repay the favour by improving every now and then?

title.children: One of these days you might blitz Hard Quiz. I don't think today will be that day

image.altText: Thumbnail prison escape

props.synopsis: Accused murderers are on the run after escaping prison with help from people on the inside, authorities say.

title.children: Prisoners leave message telling guards escape was 'too easy'

image.altText: A black and silver Visa bank card seen placed on a blurred background of another turquoise bank card

props.synopsis: Visa and Mastercard want to give artificial intelligence bots more control of Australians' bank cards, in a technological advancement they say could "revolutionise" shopping.

title.children: How AI could soon be built into your bank card — and spend your money

image.altText: Chelsey Potter is wearing a white collared shirt and smiling

props.synopsis: Once a prospective SA Liberal candidate, Chelsey Potter says she feels disillusioned and "politically homeless" - and she's not alone.

title.children: Former SA Liberal staffer says she couldn't vote for Dutton-led party

image.altText: Flavio Briatore leaning over the pit wall, through a gap in the fencing, before an F1 race

props.synopsis: In the wild, wonderful and unpredictable world of Formula 1 racing, Alpine stand alone as the undisputed leader in chaos.

title.children: The sacked Aussie, the Italian fugitive and an F1 giant's Hail Mary

image.altText: Four steaks sit side-by-side on a wooden board.

props.synopsis: When Angus cattle breeders set standards for meat quality almost 50 years ago, they started down the path to becoming one of the most dominant brands in beef. So is the next step perfection, or is it already as good as it gets?

title.children: How close can science bring us to the perfect beef breed?

image.altText: A man outside court.

props.synopsis: A Melbourne man wrongfully convicted of the notorious murders of two police officers — for which he last month secured a multi-million-dollar settlement — is now being sued over his role in an armed robbery.

title.children: Jason Roberts faces robbery lawsuit weeks after settling wrongful conviction

image.altText: A two-storey brick house is left exposed with its back wall torn off

props.synopsis: Storm systems sweeping across the US leave dozens of people dead, including 14 people killed after a tornado in south-eastern Kentucky.

title.children: Deadly tornado and severe storms sweep across US

image.altText: Adam Selwood as assistant coach of West Coast AFLW looks on during a training session

props.synopsis: Former West Coast Eagles premiership player Adam Selwood dies just months after the death of his twin brother, former Brisbane Lions player Troy Selwood.

title.children: Former West Coast premiership player Adam Selwood dies at 41

image.altText: Peter Malinauskas speaks to the media.

props.synopsis: An 18-year-old man was last week arrested and accused of threatening violent attacks on an SA school and public events, following what the premier described as the "probably the most complex and significant case" he had been briefed on. Here's a look at what we know.

title.children: What we know about alleged violent threats on SA school and events

image.altText: Nicolas Cage holds a surfboard and holds his face aggressively close to the face of Julian McMahon as a boy watches on.

props.synopsis: Filming in Yallingup, Western Australia, Nicolas Cage brings his classic freak-out energy to a claustrophobic thriller set primarily in a beachside car park.

title.children: Australia's toxic surfer culture on the big screen in new Nicolas Cage film

image.altText: Oscar Piastri gives the thumbs up after qualifying at Imola F1 Grand Prix.

props.synopsis: F1 championship leader Oscar Piastri keeps calm under pressure to put McLaren on pole position for the Emilia-Romagna Grand Prix.

title.children: Piastri maintains his cool to take pole ahead of Verstappen at Imola

image.altText: Crystal Palace celebrates winning FA Cup.

props.synopsis: Crystal Palace stuns Manchester City 1-0 in the FA Cup final to win the first major trophy of its 164-year history, thanks to a goal from local hero Eberechi Eze.

title.children: Crystal Palace seals historic FA Cup final win against Man City

image.altText: An aerial image of a housing development with a green arrow pointing downwards next to a percentage sign

props.synopsis: The Board of the Reserve Bank of Australia will be meeting on Monday and Tuesday, with economists expecting a cut to the cash rate target.

title.children: Hoping for an interest rate cut? Here's when it may happen

image.altText: A group of models strut down a runway wearing colourful gowns with a vibrant digital screen behind them

props.synopsis: It has been decades since garment manufacturing flourished in Australia, but with rising pressures on the domestic fibre and fashion industry, a strategy is being developed to bring it back.

title.children: Trump tariffs prompt push to bring clothes manufacturing back to Australia

image.altText: The Male Division, Oatlands Gaol, Tasmania

props.synopsis: Tiny cells unearthed below an old swimming pool in the Tasmanian town of Oatlands shine a light on the "miserable existence" endured by inmates who were once imprisoned at a colonial-era jail that stood on the site.

title.children: Prison cells unearthed below pool highlight Tasmania's convict past

image.altText: The fierce face of an Australian bull ant.

props.synopsis: Australia's native ants do an incredible amount of environmental and agricultural heavy lifting. Here are 10 of our mighty little workers.

title.children: There are trillions of them, and they're hard at work across Australia

image.altText: A laptop screen bearing the logos of ChatGTP and DeepSeek.

props.synopsis: More Australians are accessing generative AI chatbots for emotional guidance and assistance — seeing it as a free, personal therapist. But experts have sounded a note of caution.

title.children: Would you use an AI chatbot in place of a therapist?

image.altText: Discarded piles of waste coal rise up from the flat, barren landscape outside a Central Queensland mining town

props.synopsis: The pioneers who helped build Queensland's mining towns in the 1960s and 70s are reaching retirement, but aged care services remain thin on the ground.

title.children: Aging residents who established mining towns struggle to stay
